hypothesis_content.title: Stress Regime Exhaustion via 4H RSI Extreme & Funding Rate Reversion
hypothesis_content.statement: A STRESS regime characterized by a sharp, high-volume price decline will be exhausted and ready to transition to BEAR or NEUTRAL when BTC's 4-hour RSI reaches <15 and the aggregate perpetual funding rate across major exchanges flips from deeply negative (> -0.05%) back to neutral (between -0.02% and 0.02%) within the same 4H candle.
hypothesis_content.rationale: STRESS regimes are panic-driven. An extreme oversold 4H RSI indicates capitulation. The normalization of funding rates from deeply negative shows that the leveraged short squeeze pressure has abated, suggesting the immediate selling cascade is over. This combination often marks a local bottom and a regime shift away from STRESS.
entry_conditions: Aggregate Perp Funding Rate crosses from <= -0.05% to >= -0.02% within a single 4H candle
Volume on the 4H candle > 20-day average 4H volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 10% price rebound from entry candle close
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes below the low of the entry 4H candle

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price continues to decline sharply (>8%) within 24 hours after the signal, and funding rates return to deeply negative, indicating the stress event is ongoing.
